brand.name: WatchHouse
brand.story:
Roland Horne traded his luxury aquarium consultancy for coffee, opening the first inside an octagonal 1810 guard house on Bermondsey Street in 2014. They took the Independent title at the 2023 European Coffee Symposium in Barcelona, then the Chain award a year later. Locations now reach London, Bath, the Chrysler Building in New York, and Abu Dhabi.

A refurbished 1959 Probat UG22 from Bonanza in Berlin anchors the Maltby Street roastery. Head roaster Nikol Novotna, a Q Arabica Grader and SCA Sensory Judge, sources from Ethiopia's Bensa highlands, China's Dongka farm in Yunnan, and Brazil's Mio Fazenda. Deidra Hodgson, formerly of Aesop, leads the interiors programme.
brand.description: Cosy, unique coffee spots & eateries in London. We make great coffee and exceptional food within beautifully bespoke environments tailored around our local community. It is as simple as that. | Never worry about running out of coffee supplies again. The Modern Coffee experience from the comfort of your own home.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Specialty coffee roaster with dedicated Coffee Labs in South London and New York. Offers three coffee lines: Rituals (everyday), Ventures (adventurous), and Horizons (expressive/unusual). Sources globally with focus on provenance and quality.

gaps: Specific grinder brands/models not mentioned in accessible sources
Complete interior details for newer locations (Battersea, Marble Arch)
Architect for Somerset House interior (only furniture supplier confirmed)

facts.claim: Founded in 2014 by Roland Horne
First location opened in 19th-century octagonal brick building that served as a watch house for men guarding St Mary Magdalen's Church graveyard
Roland Horne previously ran luxury aquarium design consultancy Aquarium Architecture
Roasts on refurbished 1959 Probat UG22 purchased from Bonanza Coffee Roasters in Berlin
Probat UG22 visible through glass wall at Maltby Street roastery
Head Roaster is Nikol Novotna, Q Arabica Grader, SCA Sensory Judge, and Coffee Competition Coach
Sources from Ethiopia (highlands of Bensa, 2,260-2,360 MaSL, natural-process)
Sources from China (Dongka farm, Menglian region, Yunnan)
Sources from Brazil, Peru, and Colombia
1829 Espresso is naturally processed from Mio Fazenda in Monte Santo de Minas, Brazil (Catucai and Mundo Novo varietals)
Used Ozone coffee (Empire blend) before opening own roastery in August 2020
Maltby Street uses three Modbar group heads with steam wand
Maltby Street has four Kinto drippers mounted on individual scales for pour-over
Tower Bridge uses bespoke black La Marzocco espresso machine with golden text
Seven Dials, Marylebone, and Bishopsgate use Slayer Steam LPx espresso machines
20 locations across London, Bath, New York, and Abu Dhabi as of 2024-2025
Bath location on Old Bond Street is first location outside London
New York locations include 660 Fifth Avenue and Chrysler Building
Bermondsey Street is octagonal (lozenge-shaped) building, open to rafters with A-frame roof, retaining original chimney
Bermondsey Street redesigned by Deidra Hodgson (previously of Aesop, JAMESPLUMB and Cubitts) featuring oak and Italian travertine
Deidra Hodgson is WatchHouse design lead, designed multiple locations including Marylebone, Marble Arch, Battersea Power Station, and Chrysler Building
Somerset House features commissioned hand-drawn mural of London skyline by artist Richard Hind
Somerset House features living tree as focal point centerpiece
Somerset House is 2,300 sq ft refurbished space, opened February 2020
RoughLiving Furniture Ltd provided full joinery and furniture for Somerset House including bespoke steel table stems and oak veneer joinery
Tower Bridge (Cardamom Building, 37 Shad Thames) is former spice warehouse with white walls, dove-grey wooden booths, original structural columns
Bermondsey Street has built-in wooden bench running around three end walls, lighting in wooden shades, wood-burning stove, USB charging points along seat backs
Maltby Street is in railway arch at 36 Maltby Street with long bars running full depth of both side walls, head-high shelving, glass wall separating cafe from roastery
Sources bread from The Snapery and Little Bread Pedlar
Food suppliers include Little Bread Pedlar, The Snapery, Knead Bakery, and Blackhand Butchery
Won Best Independent Coffee Shop - Europe at European Coffee Symposium Barcelona (November 2023)
Won Europe's Best Coffee Shop Chain at 2024 European Coffee & Hospitality Awards

brand.name: Knockbox Coffee
brand.story:
Founder Mete designed the furniture for this postage stamp-sized room at the junction with Dombey Street. Exposed timber beams, Edison bulb pendants, and trailing plants fill the interior. An orange terracotta wall backs the glass pastry display. A two-group La Marzocco Linea pulls Workshop's seasonal single-origin espresso.

Outdoor picnic tables suit the English village feel of this central London corner. Weekend brunch and handmade toasties alongside a signature chai latte.

shop.name: % Arabica Bangkok Central Chidlom
shop.description: A 360-degree circular bar wraps around the centre of the Luxe Galerie zone on Level 1, inviting guests to watch every step of coffee preparation from any angle. Warm wood tones cover the bar while soft lighting washes over the counter seating—no traditional tables here. This was the first % Arabica in Thailand to serve coffee in ceramic cups rather than paper, and the first to pour cocktails and champagne alongside espresso. The 226th global location and 10th in Thailand, positioned between Chanel, Louis Vuitton, and Gucci.
shop.google_formatted_address: 1st Floor, Central Chidlom, 1027 Thanon Phloen Chit, Khwaeng Lumphini, Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330, Thailand

brand.name: % Arabica
brand.story:
Kenneth Shoji founded % Arabica in 2013 after the Tōhoku earthquake destroyed his house in Fukushima. The first store opened in Hong Kong, followed by the Higashiyama flagship in Kyoto. Kenneth owns a coffee farm in Hawaii.

World champion latte artist Junichi Yamaguchi joined the team. Parent company Asiamix Holdings manufactures Slayer machines for every store. 232 locations worldwide as of August 2025, with Thailand entry in June 2020.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Roasts at EmQuartier location with visible glass-walled roasting room and Tornado King roaster. Owns coffee farm in Hawaii. Custom Seattle-manufactured espresso machines.

brand.name: One To Two Coffee
brand.story:
Khun Po and Khun Ken opened the first branch at Kad Luang in Chiang Rai in 2018, roasting under the Everyday Coffee tagline. Kees van der Westen and Synesso machines pull Chiang Rai blends in light, medium, and dark roasts alongside Ethiopian and Brazilian single origins. The chain crossed 30 locations within three years.

The Bangkok Roastery on Nakniwat features loft-style interiors with speedbar, slow bar for manual brewing, and a visible roasting facility.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Roasts at Chiang Rai facility. Sources Arabica from local highland farms plus Ethiopian and Brazilian imports. Medium and dark profiles optimised for espresso.

gaps: Interior details for 9 shops not documented (Avenue Ratchayothin, Cyber World, Srivara, Fortune Town, town in town, True Digital Park, Ari, others)
One Bangkok branch mentioned in search results but not in shop list
